newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: PRESS DIGEST - Bangladesh Newspapers - Nov 12.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Bangladesh Newspapers - Nov 12.

text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Bangladesh press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
The government has decided to open up air transport of cargo for the private sector.
Former president H M Ershad was granted bail in two more corruption cases.
Three tigers died at Dhaka National Zoo during the last couple of days.
The government has asked industrial and business houses to abstain from organising lottery or lucky draw as means of market promotion.
The ruling Awami League has sought cooperation of the main opposition Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) to ensure law and order and security in the country.
India and Bangladesh has decided to open up their border trade.
Germany, one of major bilateral donors, has aksed the government to improve utilisation of aid money to get more funds from Bonn in future.
The ninth session of the Bangladesh-China Joint Economic Commission begins on Tuesday in Beijing.
